page.title: 03POPULATION & HOUSING
page.content: This area is quite a contrast .For the most part it is sparsely populated.{ {WINGFIELD}has been about the same size for the last 200 years. There are 260 adults on the electoral roll. There are several reasons for this : distance to work, housing cost . The {green belt}area includes Wingfield and planning permission is difficult to obtain. Only two houses have been built in the village recently; one on the site of a tin chapel and the other in a large garden. The latter required permission from {London}. On the edge of our squares is the boundary of a large {Council Estate}in Trowbridge. Few houses are visible from the main road in Wingfield , most of the Lanes are dead ends .{LOVE'S LANE}is named after a family who lived there. Pomeroy comes from the saxon Pumerig. {Shop Lane}has never had a shop.
